intro: Decaschistia occidentalis, commonly known as the western decaschistia, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
